result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontrell R Langston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, deft requests credit for 72 days.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court in writing of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  16CM1374/17CM15/15CF548.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.

16CM1374 - Case resolved with a hold open agreement.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 3; judgment w/held.  Status conf set for 11/20/17 @ 1:30pm.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Court amends bond to $1,000 signature - same conditions.

17CM15 - case dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement.  Bond may be returned to poster.

15CF548 - hold open agreement has been revoked.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 72 days.

Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.
File sent to scanning

AMENDED

948.03(2)(b) Physical Abuse fo Child - Int Cause Bodily Harm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney McGrath.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney McGrath filed a motion for clarification of bond.  The court modifies the bond to $1,000.00 cash.  Attorney McGrath indicates that she is looking into diversion programs, which will take an additional few weeks.  Status conference set for 6/22/17 @ 9:30.
to Clarify Bond

Minutes:  16CM1374/17CM15/15CF548.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Ahmad.  Deft objects to the court proceeding with the hrg with Atty Ahmad as his counsel - deft reports he fired him.  Court has not relieved Atty Ahmad of his representation - deft interrupts the court and starts reading off his papers.  Court interrupts the deft - proceedings are concluded.  Court instructs the clerk to give another date.  Atty Ahmad states for the record the deft's family reports they have retained new counsel.  Status set for 5/8/17 @ 1pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  State moves to revoke the DPA.  Deft stipulates that he did not write the required number of letters but disputes that he did not complete the counseling w/in the required time.  Testimony taken from Kimberly Rossi (counselor).  Court finds the deft did not complete the necessary requirements of the DPA.  Court revokes the DPA.  Deft is adjudged guilty.  Bond is revoked.  Deft taken into custody.  Sentencing hrg 3/27/17 @ 9am (same date as the trials on his pending charges).

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  Clerk  K. Zirbel.  Def. stipulates to revoking the Hold Open Agreement; so ordered by the Court.  Sentencing 3/10/17 at 11:30.  Bond continued.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  State's witness not available today; evidentiary hrg set over to 3/8/17 @ 2pm.
Hrg on 1/31/17 moved from 1:30pm to 2pm on court's motion.  Email sent to defense counsel & DA's office

Minutes:  16CM1374/17CM15/15CF548.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  Cases are not resolved to date; revised offer relayed yesterday.  FPT/Evidentiary hrg adj to 1/31/17 @ 1:30pm

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aneeq Ahmad.  Defense objects to the State's motion to revoke the DPA agreement.  Arguments heard on the State's motion.  Court sets the case for a Fact Finding hrg - set for 1/25/17 @ 1:30pm.

Defense reports the deft has completed his counseling.  State reports she was informed the deft had not completed his counseling and did not comply with the monthly letters.  Sentencing hrg set over to 11/11/16 @ 9am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Ahmad.  Case is resolved.  Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads guilty; judgment w/held.  Sentencing set for 10/17/16 @ 1:30pm

email received from defense counsel - information regarding deft's prior ordinance violations has now been received and parties would like a date prior to the JS date of 10/19/15.  Plea hrg set for 10/15/15 @ 2:30pm.  Parties notified via email

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Ahmad.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  Court is not inclined at this time to accept the plea offer without add'l information regarding the deft's prior DC convictions.  Amended information is stricken at this time with leave to re-file.  Deft's bond amended to add an add'l condition - deft not to reside in any place where minor reside unless related by blood without the Court's permission.  Case to be left for JS on 10/19/15.

Defendant, Dontrell R Langston, appeared with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Substitution filed on Br 8 Judge Kerkman, tab pulled for Br 3 Judge Schroeder. Bound over to Br 3. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
